glsa.title: sudo: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: A flaw in sudo's -e option may allow local attackers to execute arbitrary commands.

background.p: sudo allows a system administrator to give users the ability to run commands as other users.

description.p: The command matching functionality does not properly handle when a file in the current working directory has the same name as a pseudo-command in the sudoers file and the PATH contains an entry for ".".

impact.p: A local attacker with the permission to run sudoedit could, under certain circumstances, execute arbitrary commands as whichever user he has permission to run sudoedit as, typically root.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All sudo users should upgrade to the latest version:
